title: C programming

comments.body: Youtube has been the greatest teacher for C (the most L language)
Any recommendation for youtuber for c
Join the PES media discord server. There's a lot of good material that people send there

I personally make notes for every chapter, hit me up if you need them!

Edit: literally every CS teacher I’ve seen in PES either leaves out stuff in syllabus or teaches the WRONG thing altogether. Relying on them will just lead you to screw up. It’s better to learn yourself from online sources. If you prefer learning on your own by experimenting or building a project, try  [phind.com](https://phind.com) for all your queries. If you want a more structured approach, you can try reading the prescribed textbook. Trust me it’s not that boring. The prescribed book is ‘The C Programming Language’ by Dennis Ritchie and Brian Kernighan. They are the inventors of C so you know they know shit. 

If you still find books boring like I do, you can try the CS50 course by Harvard. There’s a freecodecamp video of it on YouTube. It’s more general and will make you fall in love with CS. 

If you lack time and want something to just pass the exams, try the Neso Academy’s course on C. I’ll paste a link here if you ask
